short_summary: Construction of a copewall at Skinners Pond Wharf
description: General construction services for the rehabilitation of an existing steel sheet pile structure at Skinners Pond Harbour, including, but not limited to: dredging and excavation, complete repairs to the steel sheet piling, backfill inside the existing structure, construct new concrete copewall, construct new concrete deck, install new curb and ladders assemblies, complete site grading and site cleanup, environmental controls and all associated items in strict accordance with specifications and accompanying drawings and subject to all terms and condition of this contract. Mobilization and demobilization of all equipment necessary to make work progress for the entire contract.
full_summary:
### Project : Skinner’s Pond Harbour Project

**Project Overview**
Canada's Department of Fisheries and Oceans is soliciting proposals for the rehabilitation of a steel sheet pile structure at Skinners Pond Harbour, located in Prince Edward Island. The construction project involves the furnishing of all necessary plant, equipment, labour, and material for repairs to the steel sheet piling, dredging and excavation, and the construction of a new concrete copewall and deck.

### Key Terms

* **Reference Number:** PW-23-01026826
* **Solicitation Number:** 30004124
* **Publication Date:** February 21, 2023
* **Tender Closing Date:** March 10, 2023 (13:00:00 hours)
* **Expected Contract Start Date:** None
* **Expected Contract End Date:** None

**Contact Information:**
* Department of Fisheries and Oceans
* Address: 200 Kent Street, Ottawa, Ontario, Canada K1A 0E6
* Email: DFOtenders-soumissionsMPO@dfo-mpo.gc.ca

**Tender Document:**
To review the full tender document and related attachments, please visit [Canada Buys Website](https://buyandsell.gc.ca).

**Scope**

The work covers the rehabilitation of the steel sheet pile structure at Skinners Pond Harbour, which includes:

* Repairing and replacing the steel sheet piling
* Dredging and excavation
* Backfilling inside the existing structure
* Constructing a new concrete copewall and deck
* Installing new curb and ladder assemblies
* Site grading and cleanup
* Environmental controls

**Solicited by:**
The Department of Fisheries and Oceans is seeking proposals from qualified contractors for this project. In order to participate, contractors must be a registered member and must obtain a copy of the solicitation document and all related attachments from the [Canada Buys Website](https://buyandsell.gc.ca).

**Tender Closing Date:**
The tender closing date is March 10, 2023 (13:00:00 hours). Late submissions will not be accepted.

**Significance of Contract**
This project has a significant impact on the fisheries and marine sector of Canada. It involves the rehabilitation of a critical infrastructure essential for the safe and sustainable management of the marine environment. ### End of Project Summary
